column4: Ever since adding a sata drive to my machine ubuntu keeps freezing, even if I run a fresh install of the sata drive
I think you are adding SATA as the first bootable device
I did but atm it is not
is there a problem w/ setting it as the first bootable device?
if you add IDE or SATA as the first bootable device the enteries in Ubuntu identifying /boot etc become ineffective since they are identified via hard drive no e.g. 0 or 1
so how would I fix it? set the drive order manually

I'll assume you have installed Ubuntu on first hd which would make it hd0, once you attach the SATA drive open Bios go to boot priority and make the first hd on which ubuntu is installed the first bootable device
it is set up that way currently, to boot off the old drive but the freezing persists
both drives are sata? and once you remove sata the system boots as usual?
the drive ubuntu is currently booting off is an ide drive

I could remove the sata drive now and it wld boot fine. It would probably stop the freezing too. I did try installing ubuntu on the sata drive and setting that as the first drive to boot from but that install kept freezing too
are you sure SATA is being recognized? you might need a bios update.
I'm not sure what you mean by that seeing it boots of the sata drive ok. The machine came shipped with a sata drive but initially I ran it off my old ata drive from my old computer
his problem seems to be a little differnt though - the bios not even supporting his sata drive. This drive came shipped with the machine...
if you remove ide and install ubuntu does the problem still persists?
